    • Constructor Detail

      • AirportDB

        public AirportDB(java.lang.String inputFile)
        This is the constructor for the AirportDB class. It reads an input file from the user and stores the airport weather and airport index in two respective array lists. If the file doesn't exist, the function goes onine to the correct url and downloads the data to create the file.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - a string object containing the file name of the winds aloft report

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        This function returns the number of airports in the aptIndex array list for the user.
        Parameters:
        none -
        Returns:
        an integer representing the number of airports in the aptIndex array list

      • getStationWeather

        public java.lang.String getStationWeather(java.lang.String strStationID)
        This function returns the number of airports in the aptIndex array list for the user.
        Parameters:
        strStationID - a 3 letter string representing an airport code
        Returns:
        a string representing the full station weather

      • getStationID

        public java.lang.String getStationID(int intPosition)
        This function uses the aptIndex ArrayList method, get(), to retrieve the contents of the array list when we know it's index.
        Parameters:
        intPosition - an integer representing the index of an ArrayList
        Returns:
        a 3 letter string representing station ID

      • getStationIndex

        public int getStationIndex(java.lang.String strStationID)
        This function uses the aptIndex ArrayList method, get(), to retrieve the contents of the array list when we know it's index.
        Parameters:
        strStationID - a string representing the 3 letter station ID
        Returns:
        an integer representing the index of the station ID in the ArrayList, aptIndex
